file.name: wmata.com-rail-station-1.0-swagger.yaml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.0 info: description: Rail line and station information, including locations, fares, times, and parking. title: Rail Station Information version: "1.0" x-apisguru-categories: - transport x-logo: url: https://twitter.com/wmata/profile_image?size=original x-origin: - format: swagger url: https://developer.wmata.com/docs/services/5476364f031f590f38092507/export?DocumentFormat=Swagger version: "2.0" x-providerName: wmata.com x-serviceName: rail-station security: - apiKeyHeader: [] - apiKeyQuery: [] tags: [] paths: /Lines: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns information about all rail lines.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Lines\r Array containing line information (Line).\r
\r
\r Line Elements\r
\r
DisplayNameFull name of line color.
EndStationCodeEnd station code. For example, will be E10 (Greenbelt) for the\r Green Line, B11 (Glenmont) for the Red Line, etc. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
InternalDestination1Intermediate terminal station code. During normal service, some\r trains on some lines might end their trip prior to the\r StartStationCode or EndStationCode. A good example is on the Red\r Line where some trains stop at A11 (Grosvenor) or B08 (Silver\r Spring). Empty string if not defined.
InternalDestination2Similar to InternalDestination1.
LineCodeTwo-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV).
StartStationCodeStart station code. For example, will be F11 (Branch Avenue)\r for the Green Line, A15 (Shady Grove) for the Red Line, etc. Use\r this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a\r station.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3314 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: >- Green E10 GR F11 Blue G05 BL J03 Silver G05 SV N06 Red B11 A11 B08 RD A15 Orange D13 OR K08 Yellow E06 E01 YL C15 summary: XML - Lines /Path: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a set of ordered stations and distances between two stations on the\r same line.

\r \r

Note that this method is not suitable on its own as a pathfinding solution\r between stations.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Path\r Array containing path details (MetroPathItem)\r
\r
\r MetroPathItem\r Elements\r
\r
DistanceToPrevDistance in feet to the previous station in the list.
LineCodeTwo-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) this station's platform is on.
SeqNumOrdered sequence number.
StationCodeStation code for this station. Use this value in other\r rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationNameFull name for this station, as shown on the WMATA website.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3316 parameters: - description: Station code for the origin station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: FromStationCode required: true schema: type: string enum: - N06 default: N06 - description: Station code for the origin station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: ToStationCode required: true schema: type: string enum: - G05 default: G05 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: |- 0 SV 1 N06 Wiehle-Reston East 30867 SV 2 N04 Spring Hill 3634 SV 3 N03 Greensboro 3902 SV 4 N02 Tysons Corner 3440 SV 5 N01 McLean 24745 SV 6 K05 E Falls Church 13156 SV 7 K04 Ballston 2980 SV 8 K03 Virginia Square 2473 SV 9 K02 Clarendon 2687 SV 10 K01 Court House 4936 SV 11 C05 Rosslyn 6993 SV 12 C04 Foggy Bottom 2783 SV 13 C03 Farragut West 2001 SV 14 C02 McPherson Square 2359 SV 15 C01 Metro Center 1561 SV 16 D01 Federal Triangle 2016 SV 17 D02 Smithsonian 2643 SV 18 D03 L'Enfant Plaza 1757 SV 19 D04 Federal Center SW 3052 SV 20 D05 Capitol South 2703 SV 21 D06 Eastern Market 3289 SV 22 D07 Potomac Avenue 3750 SV 23 D08 Stadium Armory 12162 SV 24 G01 Benning Road 7779 SV 25 G02 Capitol Heights 5215 SV 26 G03 Addison Road 7960 SV 27 G04 Morgan Blvd 7256 SV 28 G05 Largo Town Center summary: XML - Path Between Stations /SrcStationToDstStationInfo: get: description: >-

Description

Returns a distance, fare information, and estimated travel time between any two stations, including those on different lines. Omit both parameters to retrieve data for all stations.

Response Elements

Element Description
StationToStationInfos Array containing station to station information (StationToStationInfo).
StationToStationInfo Elements
CompositeMiles Average of distance traveled between two stations and straight-line distance (as used for WMATA fare calculations). For more details, please refer to WMATA's Tariff on Fares.
DestinationStation Destination station code. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
RailFare Structure containing fare information.
RailTime Estimated travel time (schedule time) in minutes between the source and destination station. This is not correlated to minutes (Min) in Real-Time Rail Predictions.
SourceStation Origin station code. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
RailFare Elements
OffPeakTime Fare during off-peak times (times other than the ones described below).
PeakTime Fare during peak times (weekdays from opening to 9:30 AM and 3-7 PM, and weekends from midnight to closing).
SeniorDisabled Reduced fare for senior citizens or people with disabilities.
operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe331b parameters: - description: Station code for the origin station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: FromStationCode schema: type: string enum: - E10 default: E10 - description: Station code for the destination station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: ToStationCode schema: type: string enum: - J03 default: J03 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: >- 25.41 J03 3.60 5.90 2.95 66 E10 summary: XML - Station to Station Information /StationEntrances: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a list of nearby station entrances based on latitude, longitude, and\r radius (meters). Omit search parameters to return all station entrances.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Entrances\r Array containing detailed information about station entrances\r (StationEntrance).\r
\r
\r StationEntrance Elements\r
\r
DescriptionAdditional information for the entrance, if available.\r Currently available data usually shows the same value as the Name\r element.
IDDeprecated.
LatLatitude.
LonLongitude.
NameName of the entrance (usually the station name and nearest\r intersection).
StationCode1The station code associated with this entrance. Use this value\r in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationCode2For stations containing multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery\r Place, Fort Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the other\r station code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3317 parameters: - description: Center point Latitude, required if Longitude and Radius are specified. in: query name: Lat schema: type: number enum: - "38.8978168" - description: Center point Longitude, required if Latitude and Radius are specified. in: query name: Lon schema: type: number enum: - "-77.0404246" - description: Radius (meters) to include in the search area, required if Latitude and Longitude are specified. in: query name: Radius schema: type: number enum: - "500" responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: >- Farragut West, 17th & I St 100 38.901098 -77.039293 Farragut West 17th & I St C03 Farragut West, 18th & I St 101 38.901453 -77.042093 Farragut West 18th & I St C03 summary: XML - Station Entrances /StationInfo: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns station location and address information based on a given\r StationCode.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Address\r Structure describing address information.\r
CodeStation code. Repeated from input.
LatLatitude.
LineCode1Two-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) served by this station.
LineCode2Additional line served by this station. This is often the case\r when stations have multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center).
LineCode3Similar to function as LineCodeX.
LineCode4Similar to function as LineCodeX. Currently not in use.
LonLongitude.
NameStation name.
StationTogether1For stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the additional\r StationCode will be listed here.
StationTogether2Similar in function to StationTogether2. Currently not in\r use.
\r
\r Address Elements\r
\r
CityCity.
StateState (abbreviated).
StreetStreet address (for GPS use).
ZipZip code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3318 parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode required: true schema: type: string enum: - A01 default: A01 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: |-
Washington DC 607 13th St. NW 20005
A01 38.8983144732 RD -77.0280779971 Metro Center C01 summary: XML - Station Information /StationParking: get: description: >-

Description

Returns parking information at a station based on a given StationCode. Omit the StationCode to return parking information for all stations.

If a station has no parking, the StationsParking element will contain no child elements.

Response Elements

Element Description
StationsParking Array containing station parking information (StationParking).
StationParking Elements
Code Station code. Useful when returning parking information for all stations. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
Notes When not NULL, provides additional parking resources such as nearby lots.
AllDayParking Structure describing all-day parking options.
ShortTermParking Structure describing short-term parking options.
AllDayParking Elements
TotalCount Number of all-day parking spots available at a station.
RiderCost All-day cost per day (weekday) for Metro riders. NULL when no all-day spots are available. For most stations, this value is identical to the NonRiderCost.

For cases where the NonRiderCost is different, the lower cost per day requires a valid rail trip using a SmarTrip® card originating from a station other than the one where the patron parked. To receive this lower rate, patrons must pay for their parking with the same SmarTrip® card used to enter/exit Metrorail, and must exit the parking lot within two hours of exiting Metrorail.
NonRiderCost All-day cost per day (weekday) for non-Metro riders. NULL when no all-day spots are available.
ShortTermParking Elements
SaturdayRiderCost Similar to RiderCost, except denoting Saturday prices.
SaturdayNonRiderCost Similar to NonRiderCost, except denoting Saturday prices.
TotalCount Number of short-term parking spots available at a station (parking meters).
Notes Misc. information relating to short-term parking. NULL when no short-term spots are available.
operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3315 parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode schema: type: string enum: - E08 - F06 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: >- F06 325 spaces metered for 12-hr. max. @ $1.00 per 60 mins. 808 4.45 4.45 2.00 2.00 15 Short term parking available 5 am - 2 am, time limit 12 hours summary: XML - Parking Information /StationTimes: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns opening and scheduled first/last train times based on a given\r StationCode. Omit the StationCode to return timing information for all\r stations.

\r \r

Note that for stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Metro Center, L'Enfant\r Plaza, etc.), a distinct call is required for each StationCode to retrieve the\r full set of train times at such stations.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
StationTimes\r Array containing station timing information (StationTime).\r
\r
\r StationTime\r Elements\r
\r
CodeStation code for this station. Use this value in other\r rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationNameFull name of the station.
*Day Elements\r Container elements containing timing information based on\r day of the week.\r
\r
\r Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday/etc.\r Elements\r
\r
OpeningTimeStation opening time. Format is HH:mm.
FirstTrains\r Structure containing first train\r information.\r
LastTrains\r Structure containing last train\r information.\r
\r
\r FirstTrains Elements\r
\r
TimeFirst train leaves the station at this time. Format is\r HH:mm.
DestinationStationStation code for the train's destination. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
\r
\r LastTrains Elements\r
\r
TimeLast train leaves the station at this time. Format is HH:mm.\r Note that when the time is AM, it signifies the next day. For\r example, a value of 02:30 under a Saturday element means the last\r train leaves on Sunday at 2:30 AM.
DestinationStationStation code for the train's destination. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe331a parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode schema: type: string enum: - E10 default: E10 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/xml: examples: response: value: >- E10 Greenbelt 04:50 05:00 F11 23:30 F11 04:50 05:00 F11 23:30 F11 04:50 05:00 F11 23:30 F11 04:50 05:00 F11 23:30 F11 04:50 05:00 F11 02:30 F11 06:50 07:00 F11 02:30 F11 06:50 07:00 F11 23:30 F11 summary: XML - Station Timings /Stations: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a list of station location and address information based on a given\r LineCode. Omit the LineCode to return all stations. The response is an array of\r objects identical to those returned in the Station Information method.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Stations\r Array containing station information (Station).\r
\r
\r Station Elements\r
\r
Address\r Structure describing address information.\r
CodeStation code. Repeated from input.
LatLatitude.
LineCode1Two-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) served by this station.
LineCode2Additional line served by this station. This is often the case\r when stations have multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center).
LineCode3Similar to function as LineCodeX.
LineCode4Similar to function as LineCodeX. Currently not in use.
LonLongitude.
NameStation name.
StationTogether1For stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the additional\r StationCode will be listed here.
StationTogether2Similar in function to StationTogether2. Currently not in\r use.
\r
\r Address Elements\r
\r
CityCity.
StateState (abbreviated).
StreetStreet address (for GPS use).
ZipZip code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3319 parameters: - description: |- Two-letter line code abbreviation:
  • RD - Red
  • YL - Yellow
  • GR - Green
  • BL - Blue
  • OR - Orange
  • SV - Silver

B11 39.0617837655 RD -77.0535573593 Glenmont summary: XML - Station List /json/jLines: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns information about all rail lines.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Lines\r Array containing line information (Line).\r
\r
\r Line Elements\r
\r
DisplayNameFull name of line color.
EndStationCodeEnd station code. For example, will be E10 (Greenbelt) for the\r Green Line, B11 (Glenmont) for the Red Line, etc. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
InternalDestination1Intermediate terminal station code. During normal service, some\r trains on some lines might end their trip prior to the\r StartStationCode or EndStationCode. A good example is on the Red\r Line where some trains stop at A11 (Grosvenor) or B08 (Silver\r Spring). Empty string if not defined.
InternalDestination2Similar to InternalDestination1.
LineCodeTwo-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV).
StartStationCodeStart station code. For example, will be F11 (Branch Avenue)\r for the Green Line, A15 (Shady Grove) for the Red Line, etc. Use\r this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a\r station.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe330c responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: Lines: - DisplayName: Green EndStationCode: E10 InternalDestination1: "" InternalDestination2: "" LineCode: GR StartStationCode: F11 - DisplayName: Blue EndStationCode: G05 InternalDestination1: "" InternalDestination2: "" LineCode: BL StartStationCode: J03 - DisplayName: Silver EndStationCode: G05 InternalDestination1: "" InternalDestination2: "" LineCode: SV StartStationCode: N06 - DisplayName: Red EndStationCode: B11 InternalDestination1: A11 InternalDestination2: B08 LineCode: RD StartStationCode: A15 - DisplayName: Orange EndStationCode: D13 InternalDestination1: "" InternalDestination2: "" LineCode: OR StartStationCode: K08 - DisplayName: Yellow EndStationCode: E06 InternalDestination1: E01 InternalDestination2: "" LineCode: YL StartStationCode: C15 summary: JSON - Lines /json/jPath: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a set of ordered stations and distances between two stations on the\r same line.

\r \r

Note that this method is not suitable on its own as a pathfinding solution\r between stations.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Path\r Array containing path details (MetroPathItem)\r
\r
\r MetroPathItem\r Elements\r
\r
DistanceToPrevDistance in feet to the previous station in the list.
LineCodeTwo-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) this station's platform is on.
SeqNumOrdered sequence number.
StationCodeStation code for this station. Use this value in other\r rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationNameFull name for this station, as shown on the WMATA website.

DistanceToPrev: 7256 LineCode: SV SeqNum: 28 StationCode: G05 StationName: Largo Town Center summary: JSON - Path Between Stations /json/jSrcStationToDstStationInfo: get: description: >-

Description

Returns a distance, fare information, and estimated travel time between any two stations, including those on different lines. Omit both parameters to retrieve data for all stations.

Response Elements

Element Description
StationToStationInfos Array containing station to station information (StationToStationInfo).
StationToStationInfo Elements
CompositeMiles Average of distance traveled between two stations and straight-line distance (as used for WMATA fare calculations). For more details, please refer to WMATA's Tariff on Fares.
DestinationStation Destination station code. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
RailFare Structure containing fare information.
RailTime Estimated travel time (schedule time) in minutes between the source and destination station. This is not correlated to minutes (Min) in Real-Time Rail Predictions.
SourceStation Origin station code. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
RailFare Elements
OffPeakTime Fare during off-peak times (times other than the ones described below).
PeakTime Fare during peak times (weekdays from opening to 9:30 AM and 3-7 PM, and weekends from midnight to closing).
SeniorDisabled Reduced fare for senior citizens or people with disabilities.
operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3313 parameters: - description: Station code for the origin station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: FromStationCode schema: type: string enum: - E10 default: E10 - description: Station code for the destination station. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: ToStationCode schema: type: string enum: - J03 default: J03 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: StationToStationInfos: - CompositeMiles: 25.41 DestinationStation: J03 RailFare: OffPeakTime: 3.6 PeakTime: 5.9 SeniorDisabled: 2.95 RailTime: 66 SourceStation: E10 summary: JSON - Station to Station Information /json/jStationEntrances: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a list of nearby station entrances based on latitude, longitude, and\r radius (meters). Omit search parameters to return all station entrances.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Entrances\r Array containing detailed information about station entrances\r (StationEntrance).\r
\r
\r StationEntrance Elements\r
\r
DescriptionAdditional information for the entrance, if available.\r Currently available data usually shows the same value as the Name\r element.
IDDeprecated.
LatLatitude.
LonLongitude.
NameName of the entrance (usually the station name and nearest\r intersection).
StationCode1The station code associated with this entrance. Use this value\r in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationCode2For stations containing multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery\r Place, Fort Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the other\r station code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe330f parameters: - description: Center point Latitude, required if Longitude and Radius are specified. in: query name: Lat schema: type: number enum: - "38.8978168" - description: Center point Longitude, required if Latitude and Radius are specified. in: query name: Lon schema: type: number enum: - "-77.0404246" - description: Radius (meters) to include in the search area, required if Latitude and Longitude are specified. in: query name: Radius schema: type: number enum: - "500" responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: Entrances: - Description: Farragut West, 17th & I St ID: "100" Lat: 38.901098 Lon: -77.039293 Name: Farragut West 17th & I St StationCode1: C03 StationCode2: "" - Description: Farragut West, 18th & I St ID: "101" Lat: 38.901453 Lon: -77.042093 Name: Farragut West 18th & I St StationCode1: C03 StationCode2: "" summary: JSON - Station Entrances /json/jStationInfo: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns station location and address information based on a given\r StationCode.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Address\r Structure describing address information.\r
CodeStation code. Repeated from input.
LatLatitude.
LineCode1Two-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) served by this station.
LineCode2Additional line served by this station. This is often the case\r when stations have multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center).
LineCode3Similar to function as LineCodeX.
LineCode4Similar to function as LineCodeX. Currently not in use.
LonLongitude.
NameStation name.
StationTogether1For stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the additional\r StationCode will be listed here.
StationTogether2Similar in function to StationTogether2. Currently not in\r use.
\r
\r Address Elements\r
\r
CityCity.
StateState (abbreviated).
StreetStreet address (for GPS use).
ZipZip code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3310 parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode required: true schema: type: string enum: - A01 default: A01 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: Address: City: Washington State: DC Street: 607 13th St. NW Zip: "20005" Code: A01 Lat: 38.8983144732 LineCode1: RD LineCode2: null LineCode3: null LineCode4: null Lon: -77.0280779971 Name: Metro Center StationTogether1: C01 StationTogether2: "" summary: JSON - Station Information /json/jStationParking: get: description: >-

Description

Returns parking information at a station based on a given StationCode. Omit the StationCode to return parking information for all stations.

If a station has no parking, the StationsParking element will contain no child elements.

Response Elements

Element Description
StationsParking Array containing station parking information (StationParking).
StationParking Elements
Code Station code. Useful when returning parking information for all stations. Use this value in other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
Notes When not NULL, provides additional parking resources such as nearby lots.
AllDayParking Structure describing all-day parking options.
ShortTermParking Structure describing short-term parking options.
AllDayParking Elements
TotalCount Number of all-day parking spots available at a station.
RiderCost All-day cost per day (weekday) for Metro riders. NULL when no all-day spots are available. For most stations, this value is identical to the NonRiderCost.

For cases where the NonRiderCost is different, the lower cost per day requires a valid rail trip using a SmarTrip® card originating from a station other than the one where the patron parked. To receive this lower rate, patrons must pay for their parking with the same SmarTrip® card used to enter/exit Metrorail, and must exit the parking lot within two hours of exiting Metrorail.
NonRiderCost All-day cost per day (weekday) for non-Metro riders. NULL when no all-day spots are available.
ShortTermParking Elements
SaturdayRiderCost Similar to RiderCost, except denoting Saturday prices.
SaturdayNonRiderCost Similar to NonRiderCost, except denoting Saturday prices.
TotalCount Number of short-term parking spots available at a station (parking meters).
Notes Misc. information relating to short-term parking. NULL when no short-term spots are available.
operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe330d parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode schema: type: string enum: - E08 - F06 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: StationsParking: - AllDayParking: NonRiderCost: 4.45 RiderCost: 4.45 SaturdayNonRiderCost: 2 SaturdayRiderCost: 2 TotalCount: 808 Code: F06 Notes: 325 spaces metered for 12-hr. max. @ $1.00 per 60 mins. ShortTermParking: Notes: Short term parking available 5 am - 2 am, time limit 12 hours TotalCount: 15 summary: JSON - Parking Information /json/jStationTimes: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns opening and scheduled first/last train times based on a given\r StationCode. Omit the StationCode to return timing information for all\r stations.

\r \r

Note that for stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Metro Center, L'Enfant\r Plaza, etc.), a distinct call is required for each StationCode to retrieve the\r full set of train times at such stations.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
StationTimes\r Array containing station timing information (StationTime).\r
\r
\r StationTime\r Elements\r
\r
CodeStation code for this station. Use this value in other\r rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
StationNameFull name of the station.
*Day Elements\r Container elements containing timing information based on\r day of the week.\r
\r
\r Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday/etc.\r Elements\r
\r
OpeningTimeStation opening time. Format is HH:mm.
FirstTrains\r Structure containing first train\r information.\r
LastTrains\r Structure containing last train\r information.\r
\r
\r FirstTrains Elements\r
\r
TimeFirst train leaves the station at this time. Format is\r HH:mm.
DestinationStationStation code for the train's destination. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
\r
\r LastTrains Elements\r
\r
TimeLast train leaves the station at this time. Format is HH:mm.\r Note that when the time is AM, it signifies the next day. For\r example, a value of 02:30 under a Saturday element means the last\r train leaves on Sunday at 2:30 AM.
DestinationStationStation code for the train's destination. Use this value in\r other rail-related APIs to retrieve data about a station.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3312 parameters: - description: Station code. Use the Station List method to return a list of all station codes. in: query name: StationCode schema: type: string enum: - E10 default: E10 responses: "200": description: Default response code. content: application/json: examples: response: value: StationTimes: - Code: E10 Friday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 05:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 02:30 OpeningTime: 04:50 Monday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 05:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 23:30 OpeningTime: 04:50 Saturday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 07:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 02:30 OpeningTime: 06:50 StationName: Greenbelt Sunday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 07:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 23:30 OpeningTime: 06:50 Thursday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 05:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 23:30 OpeningTime: 04:50 Tuesday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 05:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 23:30 OpeningTime: 04:50 Wednesday: FirstTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 05:00 LastTrains: - DestinationStation: F11 Time: 23:30 OpeningTime: 04:50 summary: JSON - Station Timings /json/jStations: get: description: "

Description

\r \r

Returns a list of station location and address information based on a given\r LineCode. Omit the LineCode to return all stations. The response is an array of\r objects identical to those returned in the Station Information method.

\r \r

Response Elements

\r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r \r
ElementDescription
Stations\r Array containing station information (Station).\r
\r
\r Station Elements\r
\r
Address\r Structure describing address information.\r
CodeStation code. Repeated from input.
LatLatitude.
LineCode1Two-letter abbreviation for the line (e.g.: RD, BL, YL, OR, GR,\r or SV) served by this station.
LineCode2Additional line served by this station. This is often the case\r when stations have multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center).
LineCode3Similar to function as LineCodeX.
LineCode4Similar to function as LineCodeX. Currently not in use.
LonLongitude.
NameStation name.
StationTogether1For stations with multiple platforms (e.g.: Gallery Place, Fort\r Totten, L'Enfant Plaza, and Metro Center), the additional\r StationCode will be listed here.
StationTogether2Similar in function to StationTogether2. Currently not in\r use.
\r
\r Address Elements\r
\r
CityCity.
StateState (abbreviated).
StreetStreet address (for GPS use).
ZipZip code.
" operationId: 5476364f031f5909e4fe3311 parameters: - description: |- Two-letter line code abbreviation:
  • RD - Red
  • YL - Yellow
  • GR - Green
  • BL - Blue
  • OR - Orange
  • SV - Silver
